title: Understanding Merkle Trees
partialText: Learn what Merkle trees are, how they work, and why this elegant data structure is critical to Git, blockchains, cloud sync, and secure systems at scale.

title: Is a Computer Science Degree Still Valuable in the Age of AI?
partialText: Kirupa Chinnathambi and Elisa Cundiff discuss how AI is transforming computer science education, the role of critical thinking, and the shifting value of a CS degree in todayâ€™s tech landscape.

title: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) Explained
partialText: Learn about MCP and what makes it the "USB-C for AI".

title: Vibe Coding + Expertise = Mega Win! ğŸ†
partialText: Vibe coding can help you go far, but the best winning combination is one where you combine vibe coding with deep expertise of what good code should look like.

title: Animating our Grid
partialText: Learn the necessary animation techniques to turn our static grid into an animated one, with DPI and frame-rate awareness built-in.

title: Counting in Negabinary (aka Base (-2))
partialText: Master negabinary (base â€“2) with visual examples! Learn how to count, convert, and do math without sign bits in this fun guide to negative-base numbers.

title: Counting in Binary and Hexadecimal
partialText: Up your cool game by learning all about our base-2 and base-16 friends, the binary and hexadecimal numbers.

title: Pascal Pixel on Design, Development, and Solopreneurship!
partialText: Hi everybody - In my latest chat, meet Pascal Pixel - a very talented designer, developer, and solopreneur. He has been tinkering in this space from a very early age and has a slew of fantastic projects that he can assign his name to, including his current project, the uniquely named Horse Browser.

title: Do we really need to know how things work? ğŸ§
partialText: With AI, is everything we are learning (or have learned) destined to be relegated to a "trivial knowledge" heap?

title: Drawing Sharp Lines on the Canvas
partialText: Ensure crisp and sharp lines by understanding the relationship between line position and line thickness/width.

title: The KIRUPA Tech Stack : It's 1998 All Over Again!
partialText: The KIRUPA site serves its millions of visitors from a toaster in the basement of an empty warehouse. To find out how much of this is true, you'll have to read on.

title: Bloom Filter: A Friendly Deep Dive
partialText: Learn how to quickly check if a value exists in a ridiculously large collection of data by using the world's favorite little probabilistic data structure, the Bloom filter.

title: Hash Functions Deep Dive
partialText: Learn all about what hash functions are and how they work to keep hashtables (and related data structures) running, protect your passwords, verify downloads, and keep the digital world running smoothly. A clear explanation of hashing for everyone...and their pets!

title: Advanced Glitch Effect with Sound
partialText: A fun coding exercise that goes deep into advanced Canvas-related JS topics.

title: AI Killed the Content Creator...Star ğŸ¤©
partialText: As Generative AI becomes faster and better, does the world need content creators?

title: Measuring the Distance Between Two Points by using the Pythagorean Theorem
partialText: Learn how to measure the distance between two points by using the Pythagorean theorem.

title: Detecting Browser Zoom Changes in JavaScript
partialText: Learn a clever approach towards detecting browser zoom changes by using the browser size and viewport size to help!

title: Creating a Fullscreen Grid
partialText: Learn how to take a simple grid and modify it to take up all available space in the browser. As always, some surprises await!

title: Drawing a Perfect Grid on the Canvas
partialText: Learn how to create crisp, responsive grids using the HTML5 Canvas and JavaScript. We cover all sorts of fun stuff like grid mathematics, DPI handling, and a boatload more.

title: Preserving the Pixel Art Look in Web Content
partialText: Learn essential CSS techniques, scaling strategies, and design principles that preserve the crisp, totally-cool aesthetic of pixel art across high-resolution displays and responsive web environments.

title: Ensuring our Canvas Looks Good on Retina/High-DPI Screens
partialText: Learn how to implement some sweet downsampling techniques to ensure what we create on the canvas looks sharp and crisp even on high-DPI screens.

title: Finding Prime Numbers Using a Sieve of Eratosthenes
partialText: Learn how the Sieve of Eratosthenes algorithm finds prime numbers using a simple sifting technique, similar to a kitchen sieve. Includes step-by-step visualization, JavaScript implementation, and beginner-friendly explanation of this ancient yet powerful mathematical method.

title: Video: Two-Dimensional (2D) Arrays in JavaScript
partialText: In this video, you'll learn how to create, access, and manipulate 2D arrays in JavaScript using both traditional as well as modern ES6-based approaches.

title: Two-Dimensional (2D) Arrays in JavaScript
partialText: Learn how to create, access, and manipulate 2D arrays in JavaScript. Discover practical examples, visualization techniques, and modern ES6 approaches for working with multi-dimensional data.

title: Animations: From Biology to JavaScript! ğŸ¦
partialText: The Cluster Growth Animation is a great example of an animation that mimics biological processes instead of following the more common physics-based path.

title: Youâ€™ll Always be Building and Designing
partialText: What you do early in your career compared to what you do later in your career has some strong overlap. The output will change, but the core building and designing activities will not. Let's dive into this.

title: Creating a Cluster Growth Animation
partialText: Learn how to recreate a biological cell growth simulation using JavaScript and HTML5 Canvas. This comprehensive guide covers the conceptual foundations of cluster growth, explains the implementation details step-by-step, and provides insights on customizing the animation's appearance. Perfect for web developers interested in creative coding and simulating natural phenomena.

title: Timsort: A Lightning Fast Hybrid Sorting Algorithm
partialText: Meet Timsort, a hybrid sorting algorithm used in Python and Java. This beginner-friendly guide breaks down its workings, advantages, and how to implement it for optimal performance.

title: Merge Sort: A Simple Step-by-Step Walkthrough ğŸ˜€
partialText: Merge Sort is pretty great for sorting all sorts of values. Seriously! There isnâ€™t a whole lot to say that is bad about it. It is performant with consistent O(n log n) time complexity, reasonable storage needs, and it also happens to be stable!

title: Bubble Sort: A Video Deep-Dive ğŸ›
partialText: Bubble sort is a simple sorting algorithm that repeatedly steps through a list, compares adjacent elements, and swaps them if they are in the wrong order. Learn all about it in this video

title: Bubble Sort: A Detailed Deep-Dive ğŸ›
partialText: Bubble sort is a simple sorting algorithm that repeatedly steps through a list, compares adjacent elements, and swaps them if they are in the wrong order. Learn all about what makes it tick and why we probably don't want to use it for larger datasets.

title: Insertion Sort: A Deep Dive! ğŸ£
partialText: Confused about insertion sort? No worries! This video and article break it down step-by-step. You'll be sorting data like a pro using insertion sort in no time.

title: Selection Sort: A Step-by-Step Guide ğŸ’¬
partialText: Learn all about selection sort and its intuitive, almost human-like, approach for sorting values.

partialText: Discover Radix Sort, a fast and efficient algorithm for sorting integers. This video explains how it works, its benefits, and why it is a better option than Counting Sort.

title: Career Growth Secrets
partialText: To grow in their career, why do many senior people switch jobs regularly? What is the secret to being successful early in your career? We cover all this and more in this article.

title: Counting Sort: The Video
partialText: Counting sort can be one of the fastest sorting algorithms...or it can be the slowest! In this in-depth video, we'll dive into what all of this means.

title: Bogosort: Sorting in the Slow Lane! ğŸ¢
partialText: Let's explore the whimsical world of Bogosort, a sorting algorithm known for its sheer inefficiency and randomness!

title: Creating Your Own Perfect Timing
partialText: Itâ€™s easy to have a great idea. Itâ€™s easy to turn this great idea into a product. What is not easy is getting the timing right. Let's dive deeper into why timing is hard to figure out and describe some ways we can get better at it.

title: Pulling Off a Successful Redesign
partialText: Redesign projects always start off with great fanfare, but very few such projects successfully cross the finish line. Let's talk about how to increase our chances of success here.

title: Radix Sort
partialText: Discover Radix Sort, a fast and efficient algorithm for sorting integers. This article explains how it works, its benefits, and provides clear implementation examples.

title: Making Counting Sort Work with Negative Values
partialText: By default, counting sort does not work with negative values. It doesn't have to be that way, so let's look at why this is the case and how to fix it to work with both negative and positive values.

title: Diving Deep into Array Index Positions
partialText: Learn all about index positions and how they help us read, write, and manipulate data in our arrays.

title: The Career Three-Body Problem
partialText: The (career) three-body problem is an impossible to solve puzzle where we try to find balance between competing objectives in our professional lives.

title: Counting Sort
partialText: Counting sort can be one of the fastest sorting algorithms...or it can be the slowest! In this in-depth tutorial, we'll dive into what all of this means.

title: Work on Problems You Deeply Care About
partialText: To be effective as a Product Manager, you should work on problems you personally care about. Doing so makes your job as a PM much easier...and also more enjoyable!

title: The Importance of Finding a Career Mentor
partialText: Think of a career mentor as your personal career friend and advisor, helping you reach your work goals. Let's talk about why it is important for you to find one!

partialText: Learn to create a random walk simulation in JavaScript, exploring concepts, practical applications, and customization options for diverse simulations.

partialText: One of the most important skills for Product Managers to master is product strategy. It is a core requirement before a PM rises to the more senior ranks of the profession. Let's dive into this all-important topic further!

partialText: Explore the whimsical world of Bogosort, a sorting algorithm known for its sheer inefficiency and randomness.

partialText: Learn how to use a remap function to transform a value from one range to another!

partialText: Learning data structures and algorithms doesn't have to be a drag. It can be intuitive and fun, and I describe why my content may be just what you need!

partialText: Part 1 of our deep dive into how well-reasoned economic policies led to a slowdown in the tech sector.

partialText: Learn all about how insertion sort and its simple approach to sorting data works.

title: Fast Sorting with Quicksort
partialText: Learn all about the quicksort algorithm in this beginner-friendly tutorial. Quicksort is a divide-and-conquer sorting algorithm that is known for its efficiency. This tutorial will walk you through the steps of quicksort, with clear explanations and examples.

title: The Monty Hall Problem
partialText: The Monty Hall problem is a probability puzzle where a counterintuitive strategy of switching doors teaches people the importance of understanding conditional probabilities and the advantage of updating their initial choices based on new information.

title: Stacks in JavaScript
partialText: Learn how to use stacks in JavaScript efficiently by exploring the fundamentals, implementation techniques, and real-world applications of this awesome LIFO structure.

title: Depth-First Search (DFS) and Breadth-First Search (BFS)
partialText: Learn all about how Depth-First Search (DFS) and Breadth-First Search (BFS) will allow you to fully traverse and explore a graph. Yes, you also have a fully functioning JavaScript implementation.

title: Introduction to the Graph Data Structure
partialText: Learn the fundamentals of the graph data structure with this beginner-friendly tutorial. Discover how graphs model relationships, their relationship to Trees, and how to implement one fully in JavaScript.

title: Big-O Notation and Complexity Analysis
partialText: Demystify the Big-O notation and its impact on helping us analyze the time and space complexity of a piece of code, an algorithm, or a data structure operation.

title: Introduction to Data Structures
partialText: Data structures are the fundamental building blocks of modern-day programming. Learn more about what they are and why they matter.

title: Arrays: A Data Structure Deep Dive
partialText: Master the art of efficient data manipulation and access with arrays, a foundational part of almost every programming language!

title: Hashtables: A Deep Dive into Efficient Data Storage and Retrieval
partialText: Learn how hashtables leverage hashing functions to store and retrieve information with lightning-fast speed, ensuring constant-time performance for key-based operations.

partialText: Generative AI isn't here to replace us. It is here to act as a force multiplier for our existing skills. Don't fight it. Embrace it.

To go deeper into the creative, technical, and societal impact of this, I chat with Chloe Barreau.

title: Heap Data Structure
partialText: The heap data structure is just what we need to find the best of something, especially if it needs to be done fast...and in style!

partialText: Learn how to create a dynamic and eye-catching spinning circle text effect using HTML, CSS, and SVG.

partialText: The tree data structure is important in programming as it provides a hierarchical organization of data that can be efficiently searched, sorted, and processed, making it a fundamental tool for many algorithms and applications.

partialText: Search items at a blazing log(n) speed by learning how binary search works, how it can be implemented, its performance details, and more.
